hours_text:
##  Plan Your Visit 

Our gardens and natural areas are open free of charge, year round from dawn to dusk. The Nevin Welcome Center will be closed Friday, January 9 through Monday, January 12, 2026. Winter operating hours are Tuesday through Saturday, 10:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. When the Nevin Welcome Center is closed, portable restrooms are available near the parking lot during spring, summer, and fall.

**Parking:** Parking is available throughout our grounds. Many areas require payment by meter, mobile-payment, and/or Cornell University permit and are enforced by [Cornell Parking and Transportation](https://fcs.cornell.edu/parking-and-transportation). Use our [interactive map](/explore/gardens/garden-map "Garden Map") to locate where to park and associated restrictions and payment information.

[Plan your visit](/visit/plan-your-visit "Plan Your Visit")

##  Get Started in the Welcome Center 

You will find interpretive exhibits, a reception desk, and fully accessible restrooms. Surrounding the welcome center are over a dozen specialty gardens that hold a large part of our cultivated plant collection.

[Explore the Nevin Welcome Center](/location/nevin-welcome-center)

##  Our Gardens and Natural Areas 

Cornell Botanic Gardens is a living museum with a mature botanic garden and arboretum—part of what makes Cornell one of the most beautiful campuses anywhere.

We steward over 3,600 acres of biologically diverse landscapes that represent the full range of ecological communities ...

We steward over 3,600 acres of biologically diverse landscapes that represent the full range of ecological communities ...
accessibility_text:
As the University’s gardens, arboretum, and natural areas, our areas have varying surfaces, slopes, and levels of access. Explore our interactive map for locations.

[Interactive Map](/explore/gardens/garden-map "Garden Map")

##  Accessibility at the Nevin Welcome Center 

Our 25-acre botanical garden includes 10 specialty gardens surrounding the Nevin Welcome Center. A wheelchair is available by request at the Garden Gift Shop in the Nevin Welcome Center, a fully accessible facility.

[Learn More](/visit/accessibility/accessibility-at-the-nevin-welcome-center)

##  Accessibility in the F. R. Newman Arboretum 

The majority of our native and cultivated tree collections are found in this beautiful 150-acre area. Paved paths and multiple parking bays throughout this hilly landscape make it easy to access the gardens and points of interest here.

[Learn More](/visit/accessibility/accessibility-in-the-f-r-newman-arboretum)

##  Accessibility in our Natural Areas 

We manage natural areas both on- and off- Cornell’s campus, with various levels of accessibility.

[Learn More](/visit/accessibility/accessibility-in-natural-areas)

##  Explore What we Offer 

Explore our gardens around the Nevin Welcome Center and in the F. R. Newman Arboretum as well as natural areas on and off the Cornell Campus.

[](/explore/gardens)

[ Gardens ](/explore/gardens)

Browse our specialty gardens and tree collections around the welcome center and within the arboretum.

collections_text:
##  Featured 

##### 

Cultural Connection 

[ Winter Solstice Heralds the Return of Light ](/winter-solstice-heralds-the-return-of-light)

The winter solstice has a great deal of meaning to human cultures because it is literally about life and death. The cycle of the seasons with life, death, and rebirth is crucial to the survival of all... 

##### 

News 

[ Cornell ash trees aim to beat back borer insects ](https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2025/11/cornell-ash-trees-aim-beat-back-borer-insects)

Ash saplings newly planted on Cornell land are potentially resistant to devastating emerald ash borer insects, making the university the first propagation center in New York state. 

##### 

Update 

[ Arboretum Seasonal Closing to Vehicles ](/arboretum-seasonal-closing-to-vehicles-0)

The F.R. Newman Arboretum closes to vehicular traffic during the winter months for protection of tree collections and public safety.
